author: Potter
text: This is a Pussy called Miss Moppet; she thinks she has heard a mouse!

author: Potter
text: This is the Mouse peeping out behind the cupboard and making fun of Miss Moppet.

author: Potter
text: He is not afraid of a kitten.

author: Potter
text: This is Miss Moppet jumping just too late; she misses the Mouse and hits her own head.

author: Potter
text: She thinks it is a very hard cupboard!

author: Potter
text: The Mouse watches Miss Moppet from the top of the cupboard.

author: Potter
text: Miss Moppet ties up her head in a duster and sits before the fire.

author: Potter
text: The Mouse thinks she is looking very ill.

author: Potter
text: He comes sliding down the bellpull.

author: Potter
text: Miss Moppet looks worse and worse.

author: Potter
text: The Mouse comes a little nearer.

author: Potter
text: Miss Moppet holds her poor head in her paws and looks at him through a hole in the duster.

author: Potter
text: And then all of a sudden--Miss Moppet jumps upon the Mouse!

author: Potter
text: And because the Mouse has teased Miss Moppet--Miss Moppet thinks she will tease the Mouse, which is not at all nice of Miss Moppet.

author: Potter
text: She ties him up in the duster and tosses it about like a ball.

author: Potter
text: But she forgot about that hole in the duster; and when she untied it-- there was no Mouse!

author: Potter
text: He has wriggled out and run away; and he is dancing a jig on top of the cupboard!
